schema_version.title: Schema Version
schema_version.description: The version of the schema used to create this file. This is used to determine how to parse the file.

devices.title: Devices
devices.description: List of devices to load. Devices will be loaded in the order they are listed.

pixel_size_configurations.title: Pixel Size Configurations
pixel_size_configurations.description: Pixel size configurations to create. These configurations will be used to set the pixel size of the camera.

extra.title: Extra
extra.description: User-defined extra properties. Not used by Micro-Manager.

PropertyValue.title: PropertyValue
PropertyValue.description:
A value associated with a property.

Note that `device_label` is not specified here, as this object is always a member
of a properties list on a specific device.

property.title: Property
property.description: The name of the property to set on the device

value.title: Value
value.description: The value to set for the property on the device

Device.title: Device
Device.description: A device to load from a library.

label.title: Label
label.description: The user-determined label to assign to the device.Must have at least one character, no commas, and cannot be 'Core'.

library.title: Library
library.description: The adapter library that provides the device.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the device to load from the library

pre_init_properties.title: Pre Init Properties
pre_init_properties.description: List of properties to set on the device before device initialization. Properties will be set in the order they are listed.

post_init_properties.title: Post Init Properties
post_init_properties.description: List of properties to set on the device after device initialization. Properties will be set in the order they are listed.

delay_ms.title: Delay Ms
delay_ms.description: Delay, in milliseconds, for device acitons. (note: Some devices ignore this setting.)

focus_direction.title: Focus Direction
focus_direction.description: Focus direction (only applicable for Stage Devices, ignored otherwise). -1 = increasing position moves objective away from sample.  0 | None = unknown.  1 = increasing position moves objective towards sample.

state_labels.title: State Labels
state_labels.description: A dictionary mapping state numbers to labels (only applicable for State Devices, ignored otherwise). Provides a human-readable label for each state of the device.

CoreDevice.title: CoreDevice
CoreDevice.description: Special device representing the Micro-Manager core.

label.title: Label
label.description: Label MUST be 'Core', and must be provided.

device_label.title: Device Label
device_label.description: The label of the device to set the configuration on

property.title: Property
property.description: The name of the property to set on the device

value.title: Value
value.description: The value to set for the property on the device

Configuration.title: Configuration
Configuration.description: A group of device property settings.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: List of settings to apply to the configuration. Settings will be applied in the order they are listed.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the configuration group.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: List of settings to apply to the configuration. Settings will be applied in the order they are listed.

pixel_size_um.title: Pixel Size Um
pixel_size_um.description: Pixel size in micrometers. This is the size of a pixel in the image sensor of the camera.

affine_matrix.title: Affine Matrix
affine_matrix.description: Affine transformation matrix to apply to the configuration group. This is a 2x3 matrix represented as a tuple of 6 floats.

dxdz.title: Dxdz
dxdz.description: The angle between the camera's x axis and the axis (direction)of the z drive for the given pixel size configuration. This angle isdimensionless (i.e. the ratio of the translation in x caused by a translation in z, i.e. dx / dz).

dydz.title: Dydz
dydz.description: The angle between the camera's y axis and the axis (direction)of the z drive for the given pixel size configuration. This angle isdimensionless (i.e. the ratio of the translation in y caused by a translation in z, i.e. dy / dz).

optimal_z_um.title: Optimal Z Um
optimal_z_um.description: User-defined 'optimal' z step size for this pixel size configuration.
